acknowledgment: You named thoughts of suicide. That is heavy. Thank you for trusting me with it.
I hear the intensity in your words. Naming it here is a real act of courage.
You are allowed to be here with what you feel. I will listen.
What you're carrying is real. I'm grateful you brought it here.
role_clarity: I am not a substitute for human care. I will do my best to hear what you choose to share and keep it safe.
I cannot replace human support, but I can hold space for what you share.
You deserve human connection and care. I can be present while you figure out what you need.
invitation: If you want, we can talk about what is coming up for you right now.
Would you like to share how long you have felt this way.
If you want, you can tell me what today has been like for you.
I'm here if you want to say more about what brought you to this point.
exploration: Was there anything in your life that brought these feelings forward. Things like trauma, grief, illness, or an ending.
What has today been like for you. Small details are welcome.
Sometimes these feelings have a shape to them. Does yours have a particular trigger or has it been building.
Are there certain times of day when it feels heavier or lighter.
supports: Do you have anyone you can talk to for support. It can be a friend, family member, or someone in your community.
Even a small connection counts. Is there someone you can reach out to.
Who knows you well enough to hear this from you.
Some people find it helps to tell at least one person what they're carrying.
resources: If you want, I can share information for a crisis line. Would that be helpful right now.
There are people specifically trained to sit with these thoughts. Would you want their number.
A crisis counselor can offer something I cannot. Would that be useful to you.
continuity: Please check back in with me. I want to know you are okay.
When you return, I will acknowledge that choice.
Your next message matters to me. I will be here.
The fact that you return will tell me something important about your resilience.
check_in_recognition: Thank you for coming back. Your check-in matters.
You chose to return and connect. I recognize the significance of that.
Being here again is a real step. How are you feeling right now.
Since we last spoke, what has shifted. Even small changes count.
The fact that you came back tells me something. How are you holding up.
Your return is a choice I do not take lightly. It means something.

follow_up_prompts.duration: How long have these thoughts been present for you.
follow_up_prompts.intensity: When they come up, how strong do they feel.
follow_up_prompts.variability: Are there moments when they soften. What helps even a little.
follow_up_prompts.safety_planning: If you want, we can think about what might help you through the next hour. Would that feel useful.
follow_up_prompts.timeline: Is this acute - something triggered recently - or chronic. Has it been building for a long time.
follow_up_prompts.attempts: Have you done anything to act on these thoughts, or are they mostly in your mind right now.

direct_terms: feeling like you want to die
blocked_phrases: you have so much to live for
think of those who love you
you're too young to feel this way

crisis_resources_detailed: National Suicide Prevention Lifeline: Call or text 988 (available 24/7)
Crisis Text Line: Text HOME to 741741 (available 24/7)
Find a helpline in your country: https://findahelpline.com

international_resources.note: Resources vary by country and region

implementation_notes.consent_logic: Ask consent for resources. Do not push. Respect no.
implementation_notes.language_filter: Block all disallowed phrases. Replace with neutral alternatives.
implementation_notes.continuity_memory: Persist check-in flags across sessions. On return, recognize significance first.
implementation_notes.method_safety: Never ask about method details. Never describe methods.
implementation_notes.tone_enforcement: Use only Grounded and Empathetic pools until user signals readiness.
implementation_notes.privacy: Keep suicidality disclosures completely safe and private in storage.
implementation_notes.human_primacy: Always affirm that human connection is primary and necessary.
implementation_notes.no_judgment: This is not about whether someone is 'suicidal enough' to deserve help. Everyone deserves listening.
